WHIM_sideproject_desc: 4 satellite transmitters & 1 geolocator, ASDN genetic and stable isotope archive
PESA_sideproject_desc: methyl mercury, avian malaria, asdn genetic and stable isotope archive, gut microbiota
Site_history: 8 years of Arctic PRISM work (2004-present) by Jennie Rausch, CWS; 3 years shorebird and habitat work (1991-1993) by Cheri Gratto-Trevor, CWS (now S&T); 1 year of shorebird habitat work (1985) by H. Loney Dickson, CWS (now retired).
Comments: For minimum nest, I entered yes because we tried to find the minumum number of nests but we were not successful. We also attempted to capture and band PESA's but were unsuccessful, in the section:  PESA_band, I have entered \yes\ to convey this.  I also recorded them as being part of the methyl mercury, avian malaria, asdn genetic and stable isotope archive, and gut microbiota side project, even though we did not procure any samples from this species.

Human_activity_description: in the heart of the Prudhoe Bay Oilfield
Weather_start: whichever date you want to download to
Weather_end: whichever date you want to download from
Site_history: Second year of this site as part of the ASDN, ninth year as part of long-term nest monitoring project.
Comments: We did not have the funding (thus personnel) this season to do the intensive ASDN work (i.e. trap/band birds, nest finding and monitoring on ASDN plots, insect trapping, intensive resighting, etc.).  The crew focused on our on-going long-term nest monitoring and predator identification projects.  We collected ASDN data as we could within the framework of these other projects.
